from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

import json
import re
import sys
import logging
import time
import os
from .autoval import AutovalUtils
from .disk_utils import DiskUtils
from .fbjbod_utils import FbjbodUtils
from .freezeray_config import FreezeRaySystemInfo
from .generic_utils import GenericUtils
from .bmc import BMCSystemInfo
from .openbmc import OpenBMCSystemInfo
from .storage.storage_device import StorageDeviceFactory
from .system_config.lspci_parser import LspciParser
from .site_utils import SiteUtils
from .system_config.system_config_utils import (
    match_in_dmidecode,
    SystemInfoException
)
from .system_config.system_logs import (
    get_last_gzip_syslog_mtime,
    get_syslogs
)
from .system_config.cpu_info import (
    get_cpuinfo,
    get_lscpu
)


[docs]class SystemInfo(object):


[docs]    def __init__(self):
        self.last_syslog = 0
        self.openbmc = OpenBMCSystemInfo()



[docs]    def get_systeminfo(self, start=True, dump_location=None):
        """
        Returns a dictionary of all system info.
        """

        AutovalUtils.log_as_cmd("+++Start of Havoc SystemInfo collection")

        # Initialize special system types to False
        wedge = False

        systeminfo = {}
        # set something in case it can't parse
        systeminfo['fru_board_mfg'] = ""
        systeminfo['fru_board_product'] = ""

        # Load ipmi drivers before using any ipmi command
        # This command will fail for Wedge or if module
        # already loaded. So, ignore status
        AutovalUtils.run_non_verbose('modprobe ipmi_si', ignore_status=True)
        time.sleep(5)
        AutovalUtils.run_non_verbose(
            'modprobe ipmi_devintf', ignore_status=True
        )
        if "autotest-local" in sys.argv[0]:
            pkg = AutovalUtils.get_rpm_info("fb-havoc-autotest-testfiles")
            logging.info("+++Running Autotest version: %s" % pkg)

        logging.info("+++Getting CPU info")
        cpu_info = get_cpuinfo()
        systeminfo.update(cpu_info)

        logging.info("+++Getting bios info")
        bios_info = get_biosinfo()
        systeminfo.update(bios_info)
        logging.info("+++BIOS vendor is: %s" % (systeminfo['bios_vendor']))

        systeminfo['bmc_type'] = self.get_bmc_type()

        logging.info("+++BMC type is: %s" % (systeminfo['bmc_type']))

        if systeminfo['bmc_type'] == 'openbmc':
            wedge = self.openbmc.is_wedge()
            if wedge:
                systeminfo['product_type'] = 'wedge'

        if not wedge and systeminfo['bios_vendor'] != 'coreboot':
            logging.info("+++System check")
            systeminfo.update(run_system_check())

            # get FRU first so the ipmi raw commands can be determined from ODM
            logging.info("+++Getting FRU info")
            systeminfo.update(get_fruinfo())

        if systeminfo['bmc_type'] == 'openbmc':
            _sys = self.openbmc.get_systeminfo()
        else:
            _sys = BMCSystemInfo().get_systeminfo(
                systeminfo
            )
        systeminfo.update(_sys)


        logging.info("+++Getting general info")
        systeminfo.update(get_generalinfo())
        logging.info("+++Getting bios info")
        systeminfo.update(get_biosinfo())
        logging.info("+++Getting mem info")
        systeminfo.update(get_meminfo())
        logging.info("+++Getting net info")
        eth = get_eth_device()
        systeminfo.update(get_netinfo(eth))
        logging.info("+++Getting eth affinity")
        systeminfo.update(get_eth_affinity(eth))
        logging.info("+++Getting sda info")
        systeminfo.update(get_bootdriveinfo())
        logging.info("+++Getting lspci info")
        systeminfo.update(get_lspci())
        logging.info("+++Getting Storage info")
        systeminfo.update(
            get_storage_info(
                self.is_cold_storage(systeminfo)
            )
        )

        systemlogs = {}

        logging.info("+++Getting lspci verbose info")
        systemlogs.update(get_lspci_verbose())

        if systeminfo['bmc_type'] == 'openbmc':
            _sys = self.openbmc.get_systemlogs()
            systemlogs.update(_sys)
        else:
            _sys = BMCSystemInfo().get_systemlogs()
            systemlogs.update(_sys)
        logging.info("+++Getting system log errors")
        if start:
            systemlogs.update(get_syslogs(self.last_syslog))
        else:
            systemlogs.update(
                get_syslogs(self.last_syslog, dump_location=dump_location)
            )

        logging.info("+++Getting project info")
        systeminfo.update(get_project_info(systeminfo))
        logging.info("Collected system info")

        _sys = {
            'systeminfo': systeminfo,
            'systemlogs': systemlogs,
        }

        if start:
            self.last_syslog = get_last_gzip_syslog_mtime()

        AutovalUtils.log_as_cmd("+++End of Havoc SystemInfo collection")
        return _sys



[docs]    def is_cold_storage(self, sys_info):
        if sys_info.get('fru_product_version', "") == 'Type 7':
            return True
        else:
            return False



[docs]    def get_server_model(self):
        wedge = self.openbmc.is_wedge()
        if wedge:
            return "Wedge"
        else:
            cmd = "ipmitool fru"
            output = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
            pattern = re.compile(
                r'Product Name \s+:(.+)$', re.MULTILINE
            )
            match = re.search(pattern, output)
            if match:
                server_model = str(match.group(1))
                return server_model
            else:
                raise SystemInfoException("Unknown server model in %s"
                                           % (output))



[docs]    def get_bmc_type(self):
        is_openbmc = self.openbmc.check_if_openbmc()
        if is_openbmc:
            return "openbmc"
        else:
            return "bmc"



[docs]    def get_centos_release(self):
        cmd = "cat /etc/centos-release"
        output = AutovalUtils.try_run_get_output(cmd)
        centos = re.search(r"release\s(\d+.\d+)", output)
        if centos:
            return centos.group(1)
        else:
            raise SystemInfoException("CMD: %s failed" % (cmd))



[docs]    def get_nic_speed(self):
        cmd = "ethtool eth0"
        output = AutovalUtils.try_run_get_output(cmd)
        speed = re.search(r"\s+Speed:\s+(\d+)", output, re.MULTILINE)
        if speed is not None:
            return speed.group(1)
        else:
            raise SystemInfoException("CMD: %s failed" % (cmd))



[docs]    def get_nic_fw(self):
        cmd = "ethtool -i eth0"
        output = AutovalUtils.try_run_get_output(cmd)
        version = re.search(r"firmware-version:\s+(.*)", output, re.MULTILINE)
        if version is not None:
            return version.group(1)
        else:
            raise SystemInfoException("CMD: %s failed" % (cmd))



[docs]    def get_mellanox_nic_value(self):
        try:
            cmd = "lspci | grep -i mellanox"
            AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
        except Exception:
            raise SystemInfoException("CMD: %s failed, Mellanox nic not found" % (cmd))
        cmd = "mlxreg -d 01:00.0 -g --reg_name SLRG -i local_port=1,pnat=0,lane=0"
        out = AutovalUtils.try_run_get_output(cmd)
        match = re.search(r"grade\s*\|(.*)", out)
        if match:
            nic_value = match.group(1).strip()
            return int(nic_value, 16)
        else:
            raise SystemInfoException("CMD: %s failed" % (cmd))



[docs]    def get_nvme_dev_fw(self, dev):
        cmd = ("nvme id-ctrl %s" % (dev))
        out = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
        nvme_fw = re.search(r"fr\s+:\s+(\w+)", out, re.MULTILINE)
        if nvme_fw is not None:
            return nvme_fw.group(1)
        else:
            raise SystemInfoException("CMD: %s failed" % (cmd))



[docs]    def get_nvme_dev_list(self):
        cmd = "nvme list"
        try:
            output = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
        except Exception:
            raise SystemInfoException("CMD: %s failed" % (cmd))

        nvme_list = []
        for line in output.split("\n"):
            m = re.match(r"(\/dev\/nvme0n\d+)\s+.*", line)
            if m:
                nvme_list.append(m.group(1))

        return nvme_list




[docs]def run_system_check():
    # We run the 'mc info' command as a basic sanity check.
    # If this doesn't work then we should immediately bail out of the test.
    # Returns output of mc info
    cmd = "ipmitool mc info"
    success = False
    mc_info = {}
    for _i in range(3):
        try:
            out = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
        except Exception as e:
            logging.error("run_system_check failure {}".format(e))
            time.sleep(5)
        else:
            success = True
            mc_info = data_str_to_dict(out, "mc_")
            break

    if not success:
        raise SystemInfoException(
            "Failed to run '%s'. Check BMC access!" % (cmd)
        )

    return mc_info




[docs]def get_fruinfo():
    """
    Returns a dictionary of ipmitool fru information.
    """
    cmd = "ipmitool fru print 0"
    # Ignore exit code of command as it can fail on some systems
    for _i in range(10):
        result = AutovalUtils.run_non_verbose(cmd, ignore_status=True)
        if result.return_code:
            # After a reboot the command can fail for a while. Sleep and retry.
            time.sleep(10)
            logging.info("+++Getting FRU")
        else:
            break
    fru_info = data_str_to_dict(result.stdout, "fru_")
    # Standarize some names
    fields = ['fru_board_product', 'fru_product_name']
    standard_names = {}
    standard_names[re.compile('Mono Lake.*')] = "MonoLake"
    fru_info = normalize_keys(fields, standard_names, fru_info)
    return fru_info




[docs]def data_str_to_dict(data_str, prefix):
    """
    Transforms data_str into a dictionary by looking for lines separated by the
    ":" character. Adds an optional prefix if passed in. Adds a counter if
    multiple lines with same entry are detected (_1, _2, ...)
    Example with "mc" prefix: Transforms this line:
    Firmware Revision         : 2.07
    Into this dictionary entry:
    "mc_firmware_revision": "2.07"
    """
    data_dict = {}
    for line in data_str.split("\n"):
        m = re.search(r'\s*(.*?):(.*)', line)
        if m is not None:
            key = m.group(1).strip().replace(" ", "_").lower()
            if not key.startswith(prefix):
                key = prefix + key
            value = m.group(2).strip()
            skip = False
            if key in data_dict:
                if data_dict[key] == value:
                    skip = True
                key_count = 1
                while ((key + "_" + str(key_count)) in data_dict.keys()):
                    if data_dict[key + "_" + str(key_count)] == value:
                        skip = True
                        break
                    key_count += 1
                key += "_" + str(key_count)
            if not skip:
                data_dict[key] = value
    return data_dict




[docs]def normalize_keys(key_list, normalization, config_dict):
    """
    Normalizes all 'config_dict' keys specified in key_list using the
    normalization dictionary which contains a regular expression that if
    matched is replaced with a normalized string.
    """
    for key in key_list:
        if key in config_dict:
            for regex, normal in normalization.items():
                m = re.search(regex, config_dict[key])
                if m:
                    config_dict[key] = normal

    return config_dict




[docs]def get_generalinfo():
    """
    Returns a dictionary of general system info.
    (hostname, kernel, os version)
    """
    generalinfo = {}
    generalinfo["hostname"] = AutovalUtils.run_get_output("hostname")
    generalinfo["kernel"] = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(
        "uname --kernel-release"
    )
    os_version = "unknown"
    try:
        os_version = AutovalUtils.run_get_output("cat /etc/system-release")
    except Exception:
        # Pass for ramdisks
        pass
    generalinfo["os_version"] = os_version
    generalinfo["console"] = AutovalUtils.run_get_output("cat /proc/cmdline")
    return generalinfo




[docs]def get_biosinfo():
    """
    Returns a dictionary of all bios/me/bmc/cpld/vr/fsc information.
    (bios vendor, bios version, bios release, me version, fsc version)
    """
    biosinfo = {}
    bios_dict = match_in_dmidecode("bios")
    for b_info in bios_dict:
        if b_info['device_type'] == "BIOS Information":
            biosinfo['bios_version'] = b_info['Version']
    biosinfo['dmidecode_bios_json'] = json.dumps(bios_dict)
    biosinfo['bios_vendor'] = AutovalUtils.run_get_output("dmidecode --string bios-vendor")
    return biosinfo




[docs]def get_meminfo():
    """
    Returns a dictionary of memory information.
    (total ram, maximum capacity, speed, manufacturer, serial, size, part no.)
    """
    meminfo = {}
    ram_total_kb = None
    try:
        ram_total_kb = AutovalUtils.run_get_match(
            r'MemTotal:\s*(\d+)\s*kB', "cat /proc/meminfo"
        )
    except Exception:
        pass
    meminfo["ram_total_kb"] = ram_total_kb
    meminfo['dmidecode_memory_json'] = json.dumps(match_in_dmidecode("memory"))
    return meminfo




[docs]def get_eth_device():
    out = AutovalUtils.try_run_get_output("ifconfig")
    m = re.search(r"^(eth\d):\sflag", out, re.MULTILINE)
    if m:
        return m.group(1)
    else:
        m = re.search(r"^(eth\d)\s+Link", out, re.MULTILINE)
        if m:
            return m.group(1)
        else:
            raise SystemInfoException("Unable to get eth device")




[docs]def get_netinfo(eth):
    """
    Returns a dictionary of network informtion.
    (driver, firware, ring buffer, speed, version, oob MAC, oob ip)
    """
    net_info = {}
    cmd = "ethtool -i %s" % (eth)
    result = AutovalUtils.run_non_verbose(cmd)
    for line in result.stdout.split("\n"):
        m = re.search('(.*):(.*)', line)
        if m is not None and m.group(2) is not "":
            key = "net_eth_" + m.group(1).strip().replace(" ", "_").lower()
            value = m.group(2).strip()
            if "bus" in key:
                continue
            key_count = 1
            while (key in net_info.keys()):
                key_count += 1
                key += str(key_count)
            net_info[key] = value
    cmd = "ethtool %s" % (eth)
    result = AutovalUtils.run_non_verbose(cmd)
    net_info['net_eth_speed'] = re.search(
        r'Speed:\s*(.*)\n', result.stdout).group(1)
    cmd = "ethtool -g %s" % (eth)
    result = AutovalUtils.run_non_verbose(cmd)
    stdout = result.stdout.split("\n")
    net_info['net_eth_ring_buf'] = "%s/%s %s/%s" \
            % (stdout[7].split()[1], stdout[2].split()[1],
                    stdout[10].split()[1], stdout[5].split()[1])
    mac = "%s_mac" % (eth)
    cmd = "ifconfig %s" % (eth)
    result = AutovalUtils.run_non_verbose(cmd)
    m = re.search(r'ether\s([\w\d:]+)', result.stdout)
    if m:
        net_info[mac] = m.group(1)
    else:
        m = re.search(r'HWaddr\s*(.*)', result.stdout)
        if m:
            net_info[mac] = m.group(1)
        else:
            raise SystemInfoException(
                "Unable to find MAC address for %s" % (eth)
            )

    # @@@ TODO: Add IP methods
#    net_info['net_ip'], net_info['net_hwaddr'] = get_ip_mac(eth)
#
#    net_info['net_oob_ip'], net_info['net_oob_hwaddr'] = get_oob_ip_mac()

    return net_info




[docs]def get_eth_affinity(eth):
    """
    Returns a dictionary with one key/value pair showing eth affinity
    information.
    """
    affinity_info = {}
    affinity_info['net_affinity_irq'] = ""
    affinity_info['net_affinity'] = ""
    cmd = "cat /proc/interrupts | grep %s- " % (eth)
    cmd += "| awk '{print $1}' | sed 's/://'"
    result = AutovalUtils.run_non_verbose(cmd)
    irqs = result.stdout.splitlines()
    irqcount = 0
    for line in irqs:
        irq = line.strip()
        cmd = "cat /proc/irq/%s/smp_affinity" % irq
        try:
            result = AutovalUtils.run_non_verbose(cmd)
            stdout = result.stdout
        except Exception:
            stdout = "??,????????"
            logging.info("***error: [%s]" % (cmd))
        irqcount += 1
        affinity_info['net_affinity_irq'] += "%s " % irq
        affinity_info['net_affinity'] += "%s " % stdout.strip()
    affinity_info['net_affinity_irq'] += "(total: %s )" % irqcount
    return affinity_info





[docs]def get_bootdriveinfo():
    """
    Returns a dictionary of boot drive information.
    (capacity, hw configuration, partition inf)
    Boot drive may be sda or nvme (flash)
    """
    try:
        boot_drive = DiskUtils.get_boot_drive()
    except Exception:
        # No boot drive detected, continue anyhow
        return {}
    if boot_drive.startswith("sda"):
        return get_sdainfo()
    elif boot_drive.startswith("nvme"):
        return get_nvmeinfo()
    else:
        logging.info("No boot drive detected")




[docs]def get_sdainfo():
    """
    Returns a dictionary of bootdisk information.
    """
    cmd = "fdisk -l /dev/sda"
    result = AutovalUtils.run_non_verbose(cmd)
    stdout = result.stdout
    info = parse_fdisk(stdout)

    cmd = "smartctl -i /dev/sda"
    result = AutovalUtils.run_non_verbose(cmd)
    stdout = result.stdout
    info.update(parse_smartctl(stdout))
    return info




[docs]def get_nvmeinfo():
    """
    Returns a dictionary of bookdisk/nvme information.
    """
    info = {}

    cmd = "nvme list"
    result = AutovalUtils.run_non_verbose(cmd, ignore_status=True)
    if result.return_code:
        logging.info("No boot drive by name /dev/nvme")
        return info
    stdout = result.stdout

    nvme_table = parse_table(stdout)
    info['bootdrive_partition'] = nvme_table[0]['node']
    info['bootdrive_sn'] = nvme_table[0]['sn']
    info['bootdrive_model'] = nvme_table[0]['model']
    info['bootdrive_fw_rev'] = nvme_table[0]['fw rev']

    node = info['bootdrive_partition'] or "/dev/nvme*"
    cmd = "fdisk -l %s" % node
    result = AutovalUtils.run_non_verbose(cmd)
    stdout = result.stdout
    info.update(parse_fdisk(stdout))

    cmd = "nvme smart-log %s" % node
    result = AutovalUtils.run_non_verbose(cmd)
    info['nvme_smart-log_json'] = json.dumps(parse_nvme_smartlog(result.stdout))
    return info




[docs]def parse_smartctl(cmd_output):
    """ Parse smartctl -i /dev/sda command output and return a dictionary """
    pat = re.compile(r'(.*?)\s*:\s*(.*)$', re.MULTILINE)
    key_map = {'Device Model': 'bootdrive_model',
               'Serial Number': 'bootdrive_sn',
               'Firmware Version': 'bootdrive_fw_rev'}
    info = {'bootdrive_partition': '/dev/sda'}
    for match in re.finditer(pat, cmd_output):
        if match.group(1) in key_map.keys():
            info[key_map[match.group(1)]] = match.group(2)
    return info




[docs]def parse_nvme_smartlog(cmd_output):
    """ Parse nvme smart-log command output and return a dictionary """
    pat = re.compile(r'(.*?)\s*:\s*(.*)$', re.MULTILINE)
    keys = ['critical_warning', 'media_errors']
    info = {}
    for match in re.finditer(pat, cmd_output):
        if match.group(1) in keys:
            info[match.group(1)] = match.group(2)
    return info




[docs]def parse_fdisk(cmd_output):
    """ Parse fdisk command output and return a dictionary """
    # Use named capture groups to assign to info dictionary
    r = re.search(r'Disk.*?dev.*?:\s*(?P<bootdrive_capacity>.*?)'
                   r',\s*(?P<bootdrive_capacity_bytes>.*?) bytes', cmd_output)
    info = r.groupdict()

    partition = {}
    for line in cmd_output.split("\n"):
        if re.match('^/dev/', line):
            dev = line.split()[0]
            size = line.split()[4]
            partition[dev] = size
    info["partition_size_json"] = json.dumps(partition)
    return info




[docs]def parse_table(text):
    """ Parse column data from a table. Example:
table = parse_table(
'Node             SN                   Model
---------------- -------------------- ----------------------------------------
/dev/nvme0n1     FI5BQ00851CY6BI03    HFS256GD9MNC-5310A
/dev/nvme0n2     FI5BQ00851CY6BI04    HFS256GD9MNC-5310B
')
table[0]['node'] = '/dev/nvme0n1'
table[1]['sn'] = 'FI5BQ00851CY6BI04'
"""
    lines = text.splitlines()
    header = lines.pop(0)
    col_hint = lines.pop(0)
    # Use space characters for column separators
    col_start = [m.start() for m in re.finditer(r'\S+', col_hint)]
    cols = [x.lower() for x in split_at(header, col_start)]
    table = []
    for line in lines:
        row = dict((cols[i], v) for i, v in enumerate(split_at(line, col_start)))
        table.append(row)
    return table



[docs]def split_at(line, positions):
    """ Split a line at positions, strip white space and return list """
    pos = positions + [len(line)]  # Final position is end of line
    return [line[pos[i]:pos[i + 1]].strip() for i in range(len(pos) - 1)]



[docs]def get_lspci():
    """
    Returns lspci output
    """
    lspci = {}
    lspci['lspci'] = LspciParser().get_lspci_output()
    return lspci



[docs]def get_storage_info(is_cold_storage):

    storage = {}
    storage.update(get_drive_list(is_cold_storage))
    jbod_data = get_jbod_data()
    if jbod_data:
        storage.update(jbod_data)
        storage.update(get_jbod_event_status())
        storage.update(get_jbod_event_logs())
    return storage



[docs]def get_drive_list(is_cold_storage):
    """
    Returns the list of SSD/Flash devices connected to this host
    """
    ssd_list = {}
    drive_list = {}
    drives = []
    power_on_all_slots = True
    # Type 7 systems doesn't need all the drives of expander to be powered-on
    # It is expected to have only few drives in all expander at any time.
    if is_cold_storage:
        power_on_all_slots = False
    drive_list = DiskUtils.get_storage_devices(power_on_all_slots=power_on_all_slots)
    if drive_list:
        drive_list_obj = StorageDeviceFactory.create(drive_list)
        for drive in drive_list_obj:
            serial = "unknown"
            manufacturer = "unknown"
            if 'serial_number' in drive.data:
                serial = drive.data['serial_number']
            if 'manufacturer' in drive.data:
                manufacturer = drive.data['manufacturer']
            drives.append("%s_%s" % (serial, manufacturer))
        drives.sort()
        ssd_list['ssd_list'] = ','.join(drives)
    return ssd_list



[docs]def get_jbod_data():
    """
    Returns jbod data (if present)
    """
    jbod_data = {}
    try:
        data = FbjbodUtils.get_jbod_info_dict()
        for device in data.keys():
            flattened = GenericUtils.flatten_dict(data[device], prefix='jbod_')
            jbod_data = flattened
    except Exception:
        return jbod_data

    return jbod_data




[docs]def get_jbod_event_status():
    """
    Returns the event status of all jbod devices if present
    """
    event_log = {}
    try:
        status_info = FbjbodUtils.get_event_status()
        event_log['fbjbod_event'] = status_info
    except Exception:
        pass

    return event_log




[docs]def get_jbod_event_logs():
    """
    Returns the Expander logs
    """
    expander_log = {}
    try:
        log_info = FbjbodUtils.get_expander_logs()
        expander_log['fbjbod_event_log'] = log_info
    except Exception:
        pass

    return expander_log



[docs]def get_lspci_verbose():
    """
    Returns lspci -vvv / lspci -xxx output
    """
    lspci = {}
    cmd = "ipmitool fru list"
    sys_chk = AutovalUtils.try_run_get_output(cmd)
    # Skip -xxx for now as it creates problems with the config check
#    cmd = "lspci -xxx"
#    lspci['lspci_xxx'] = AutovalUtils.try_run_get_output(cmd)

    # Exclude DevSta lines as they include current device status, which can
    # change during test.
    # cmd = "lspci -vvv | grep -v DevSta | grep -v Status"
    # lspci['lspci_vvv'] = AutovalUtils.try_run_get_output(cmd)
    if sys_chk and 'BIGSUR' in sys_chk:
        lspci['lspci_v'] = LspciParser().get_lspci_output(
            options="-v",
            custom_logfile="lspci_vvv.log",
        )
    else:
        lspci['lspci_vvv'] = LspciParser().get_lspci_output(
            options="-vvv",
            custom_logfile="lspci_vvv.log",
            exclude=["DevSta", "Status"]
        )
    lspci["lspci_lnksta_lnkcap"] = compare_lspci_lnksta_lnkcap(
        list(lspci.values())[0]
    )

    return lspci




[docs]def compare_lspci_lnksta_lnkcap(lspci_output):
    # compare lspci lnksta speed and capacity woth lnkcap only for network
    # and nvme devices
    devices = ["nvm", "ethernet"]
    status = ""
    for dev in devices:
        dev_list = LspciParser().get_lnksta_lnkcap(lspci_output, dev)
        for each in dev_list:
            cap_speed = each["cap_speed"]
            sta_speed = each["sta_speed"]
            cap_width = each["cap_width"]
            sta_width = each["sta_width"]
            dev_line = each["dev_line"]
            if dev_line:
                st_speed = "\n %s: 'cap_speed' %s compare to 'sta_speed' %s: %s"
                st_width = "\n %s: 'cap_width' %s compare to 'sta_width' %s: %s"
                if cap_speed and sta_speed:
                    if cap_speed != sta_speed:
                        status += st_speed % (dev_line, cap_speed, sta_speed, "Failed")
                else:
                    status += st_speed % (dev_line, cap_speed, sta_speed, "Failed")
                if cap_width and sta_width:
                    if cap_width != sta_width:
                        status += st_width % (dev_line, cap_width, sta_width, "Failed")
                else:
                    status += st_width % (dev_line, cap_width, sta_width, "Failed")
    return status




[docs]def get_project_info(systeminfo):
    """
    Returns information about Hardware project
    """
    projectinfo = {}
    projectinfo['project_name'] = 'Unknown'
    # Higher priority fields for project name should go last so they overwrite
    # the lower priority fields

    if 'fru_product_name' in systeminfo:
        projectinfo['project_name'] = systeminfo['fru_product_name']

    if 'product_type' in systeminfo:
        projectinfo['project_name'] = systeminfo['product_type']
    # Special case for Yosemite where project name is stored in
    # fru_device_description:
    for key in ['fru_device_description', 'fru_device_description_1']:
        yosemite = systeminfo.get(key, "")
        if yosemite.startswith('Yosemite'):
            projectinfo['project_name'] = 'Yosemite'
    if systeminfo.get('fru_product_version', '') == 'YoMo01':
        projectinfo['project_name'] = 'Yosemite'
    elif systeminfo.get('fru_product_version', '') == 'YoTL02':
        projectinfo['project_name'] = 'Yosemite V2'
    if 'jbod_product' in systeminfo:
        projectinfo['project_name'] = systeminfo['jbod_product']

    if projectinfo['project_name'] == "Type8 Tioga Pass Single Side":
        projectinfo['project_name'] = "Lightning V2"
    fields = ['project_name']
    standard_names = {}
    standard_names[re.compile('.*Mono Lake.*', re.IGNORECASE)] = "Mono Lake"
    standard_names[re.compile('.*Leopard.*', re.IGNORECASE)] = "Leopard"
    standard_names[re.compile('.*Tioga Pass.*', re.IGNORECASE)] = "Tioga Pass"
    standard_names[re.compile('.*Lightning V2.*', re.IGNORECASE)] = "Lightning V2"
    standard_names[re.compile('.*Wedge.*', re.IGNORECASE)] = "Wedge"
    standard_names[re.compile('BC4U', re.IGNORECASE)] = "Bryce Canyon"
    standard_names[re.compile('HB2U', re.IGNORECASE)] = "Honey Badger"
    standard_names[re.compile('Knox2U', re.IGNORECASE)] = "Knox"
    standard_names[re.compile('Robinson Creek.*', re.IGNORECASE)] = "Robinson Creek"
    standard_names[re.compile('Eagle Peak.*', re.IGNORECASE)] = "Eagle Peak"

    projectinfo = normalize_keys(fields, standard_names, projectinfo)

    # Special case for Wedge:
    # Project name can be retrieved from CPU Model ID:
    # C2550 = Wedge 40
    # E3845 = Wedge 100
    # D1508 = Wedge 100S.
    if projectinfo['project_name'] == 'Wedge':
        if systeminfo.get('cpu_modelname'):
            models = {
                re.compile('C2550'): 'Wedge40',
                re.compile('E3845'): 'Wedge100',
                re.compile('D1508'): 'Wedge100S',
            }
            for cpu_model, wedge_model in models.items():
                if re.search(cpu_model, systeminfo['cpu_modelname']):
                    projectinfo['project_name'] = wedge_model

    return projectinfo
